p: During the 9-yr time period, female workers accounted for 513 cases (60.3%) of compensated cases ( Table 1). The most common age group was 20-29 yr old (294 cases, 34.5%) ( Table 2). The most frequent disease was tuberculosis (283 cases, 35.8%), followed by scrub typhus (280 cases, 35.4%) and viral hepatitis (44 cases, 5.6%) ( Table 3).
